text: The primary role of agriculture is the provision of

options.C: food for man and his animals

explanation: The primary role of agriculture is the provision of food for man and his animals.

text: In subsistence agriculture
explanation: Subsistence agriculture or farming is a form of farming in which nearly all the crops or livestock raised are used to maintain the farmer and farmers family, leaving little, if any, surplus for sale or trade.

text: Gestation period is defined as the time

options.A: of fusion of the sperm and the egg
options.C: of release of ovum from the ovary
options.D: of the birth of the young animal

explanation: Gestation period is defined as the time between conception and birth (parturition).

text: The hormone responsible for milk let down in female farm animals is
explanation: Oxytocin is a hormone that is involved in childbirth and breast-feeding.

text: The adult male cattle is called
explanation: The adult male cattle is called a BULL.

text: Layer's ration contains more limestone than grower's ration because limestone

options.A: is difficult for the growers to digest
options.C: reduces the acidity in the gut if growers
options.D: supplies sufficient minerals to layers for shell formation

explanation: Layer's ration contains more limestone than grower's ration as limestone supplies calcium which is needed for shell formation in layers.

text: Which of the following is not a method of improving rangeland?
explanation: The practice of continuous grazing is not a method of controlling rangeland.

text: Miracidium is one of the stages in the life cycle of
explanation: Miracidium is the free swimming larva of trematodes (liver fluke) which emerges from an egg and penetrates the body of a snail host.

text: Which of the following is not a symptom of foot and mouth disease of cattle?
explanation: The foot and mouth disease of cattle is not characterized by blood stained diarrhea.

text: Heavy infestation of liver fluke causes poor absorption of fats in livestock by

options.A: blocking bile ducts thus preventing flow of bile
options.D: inhibiting the action of digestive enzymes

explanation: A liver fluke is a parasitic worm. After liver flukes have been ingested, they travel from the intestines to the bile ducts in the liver where they live and grow. They grow so much that they contaminate the bile and this affects fat-digesting enzymes.

text: Methods of preserving fish include the following except
explanation: Boiling is not a method of preserving fish.

text: Which of the following fishing gears can be used for total harvesting of pond?
explanation: It is because of the way it is constructed, dragnet can be used for the total harvesting of ponds.

text: The practice of mating closely related animals is called
explanation: Inbreeding is the mating of organisms closely related by ancestry.

text: The natural resource utilized for production is
explanation: Land is a natural resource utilized for production.

text: An increase in supply of agricultural produce can be caused by the following factors except
explanation: Consumers buying less product will not contribute to an increase in the supply of agricultural produce.

text: Which of the following constitutes subsidy in agricultural enterprise?

options.A: supply of fertilizers to farmers at reduced price
options.B: borrowing of money from a thrift society
options.C: provision of money to farmers through commercial banks
options.D: provision of services through cooperative societies

explanation: Supply of fertilizers to farmers at reduced price constitutes subsidy.

text: Records of money transactions in a farming business are termed
explanation: Farm accounts are statements of money paid out or received for goods and services used in the running of the farming business.

text: An advantage of extensive system of rearing goats is
explanation: Extensive agriculture is an agricultural production system that uses small inputs of labour, fertilizers and capital, relative to the land being farmed.In the case of extensive method of rearing goats, goats are allowed to graze freely on a large area of land with little labour requirement.

text: The main processes involved in the marketing of cotton include the following except
explanation: Weeding is not involved in the packaging of cotton.

text: Which of the following agricultural extensions aims at reaching a large number of farmers at the same time?
explanation: Mass method aims at reaching a large number of farmers at the same time.

text: Which of the following is not an example of edaphic factors?
explanation: Storm is not an edaphic factor.

text: The practice of bee farming is called
explanation: Apiculture is the practice of managing honeybee colonies for farming purposes.

text: The study of insect pests of crops is called
explanation: Entomology is the study of insects.

text: Which of the following is not a characteristic of metamorphic rock?

options.D: they may be hard and massive

explanation: Metamorphic rocks have been put under great pressure, heated, squashed or stretched and fossils do not survive these extreme conditions.

text: What is the full meaning of IITA?

options.C: Institute of Investment and Trade Agriculture

explanation: IITA stands for The International Institute of Tropical Agriculture (IITA).

text: Rocks formed by the cooling and solidification of molten rocks called magma ejected from beneath the earth's crust is
explanation: Rocks formed by the cooling and solidification of molten rocks called magma ejected beneath the earth's crust are igneous rocks.

text: Which of the following is a friend of farmer
explanation: Earthworms are referred to as farmer friend because they improve soil structure, water holding capacity and enrich soil nutrients.

text: The source of food for fishes in the river is called
explanation: The source of food for fishes in the river are planktons.

text: A farmer bought a farm implement for ₦12,500 in 2007. At the end of the fourth year, he sold it for ₦4,300. The annual depreciation of the implement is
explanation:
Cost price in 2007 - ₦12,500Year of usage = 4 yearsSelling Price = ₦4,300
Annual  Depreciation \(\frac{₦12,500 - ₦4,300}{4}\)
= \(\frac{₦8,200}{4}\) = ₦2,050

text: The average weather condition of a place, measured over a long period of time is called
explanation: Climate is the average weather in a given area over a long period of time.

text: Which of the following equipment is a farm implement?
explanation: Farm implements are the tools used for growing and harvesting crops. Mower is not a farm implement.

text: A periodic maintenance activity carried out using a farm tractor is
explanation: A periodic maintenance activity carried out on farm tractor is changing of engine oil.

text: Which of the following sources of farm power is most versatile in West Africa?
explanation: The most versatile source of farm power in West Africa is animal.

text: Farm surveying equipment include the following except
explanation: Spade is not a surveying equipment.

text: A piece of land is said to be on lease to a farmer when the land is

options.B: given to him as a gift
options.D: given for a specific period on rental basis

explanation: A piece of land is said to be lease to a farmer when the land is given for a specific period on rental basis.

text: The problems associated with land tenure through inheritance include the following except

options.A: small land holdings for family members
options.B: hatred among family members arising from land sharing
options.C: right of individuals to free use and control of inherited land
options.D: difficulty to sell part of inherited land

explanation: Right of individuals to free use and control of inherited land is not a problem of land tenure through inheritance.

text: The alternate heating and cooling of rocks result in
explanation: The alternate heating and cooling of rocks results in fragmentation.

text: Which of the following factors influence agricultural production is biotic factor?
explanation: Parasite is a biotic factor.

text: The system in which a farmer uses a piece of land for a period and abandons it for another land is called
explanation: Shifting agriculture is a system of cultivation in which a plot of land is cleared and cultivated for a short period of time, then abandoned and allowed to revert to producing its normal vegetation while the cultivator moves on to another plot.

text: What is the percentage water content of soil sample which weighed 180g when fresh and 120g when oven-dried?
explanation:
Mass of fresh soil = 180gMass of over dried soil = 120gMass of water = 180g - 120g = 60g
% of Water = \(\frac{60g}{18og}\)  x 100
= \(\frac{1}{3}\) x 100 = 33.33%

text: The main objectives of agriculture is
explanation: The main objective of agriculture is to produce food for the general human population.

text: Food shortage can be minimized by
explanation: Food shortage can be minimized by efficient pest control services.N.B: Pests are organisms that feed on agricultural produce thereby causing shortage of food.Pests need to be controlled for food shortage to be minimized.

text: Subsistence agriculture is characterized by
explanation: Subsistence agriculture is characterized by small farm holdings.N.B: Subsistence agriculture is practiced for purposes that are not commercial. Hence, it is a small scale agriculture that is characterized by small farm holdings, use of crude farm implement, low yield, etc.

text: Output is higher in commercial agriculture because of the following reasons except

options.B: cultivation of large hectares of land

explanation: Output is higher in commercial agriculture because of the following reasons:- Adequate finance- Utilization of complex farm machinery- Cultivation of large hectaresN.B: Commercial agriculture does not really need large labour force (man power) as machines have proven to be faster and more efficient than human beings.

text: The most common factor affecting land use is
explanation: The most common factor affecting land use is population pressure. It should be noted that the other options do not mostly affect land use.

text: Financial assistance from government to the farmers is usually in the following forms except
explanation: Financial assistance from the government to farmers is usually in the form of the following:- Loan- Credit facility- Subsidy

text: Which of the following groups of animals is usually kept in game reserves?
explanation: Animals kept in game reserves are mostly wild animals, and those used for sporting activities.

text: The following processes in crops are sensitive to daylength except
explanation: Fruiting, growth and flowering are sensitive to daylength but not branching.

text: Rain water is made available to crops through
explanation: Rain water is made available to crops through root absorption. When rain water gets to the soil, it becomes part of soil water which is absorbed through root hairs. It should be noted that the walls of root hairs are permeable and consist of pectic substances and cellulose which are strongly hydrophilic.

text: Which of the following rocks is formed from shale?
explanation: Shales that are subject to heat and pressure of metamorphism alter into a hard, fissle, metamorphic rock known as slate.

text: The horizon of a soil profile which encourages the greatest level of microbial activity is
explanation: The A-horizon is a weathered layer that contains an accumulation of humus (decomposed, dark-coloured, carbon-rich matter) and microbial biomass that is mixed with small-grained minerals to form aggregate structures.

text: The easiest method of determining soil texture in the field is by
explanation: Feeling or field texturing is a quick method of determining soil texture, and enables an immediate interpretation of texture down the soil profile.

text: The type of soil with a particle size of 0.02 to 0.002mm is
explanation: Fine sand → 0.2mm - 0.02mmSilt particles → 0.02mm - 0.002mmClay particles → less than 0.002mm

text: If urea fertilizer contains 46% nitrogen, calculate the amount of nitrogen in 25kg bag of fertilizer?
explanation: The amount of nitrogen = \(\frac{46}{100}\) x 25 = 11.5kg

text: Fertile soil is one which

options.C: can produce a good harvest of cowpea
options.D: contain all essential plant nutrients in suitable proportion

explanation: Fertile soil is one which contains all the plant nutrients in the right proportion.A fertile soil will contain all the major nutrients for basic plant nutrition (e.g nitrogen, phosphorus and potassium), as well as other nutrients needed in smaller quantities (e.g calcium, magnesium, sulfur, ion e.t.c).

text: The effects of practicing crop rotation include the following except

options.D: preventing the build-up of pests and diseases

explanation: Crop rotation does not add humus to the soil.

text: The method of irrigation suitable for use on a steep slope is
explanation: The method of irrigation suitable for use on a steep slose is Shadoof Irrigation.

text: The main source of power for subsistence agriculture is
explanation: The main source of power for substinence agriculture is man. Substinence agriculture involves the production of food on a small scale by a farmer to cater mainly for his family. As a result, the use of machinery is not needed, rathe the farmer relies on man power to achieve everything he needs to carry out on the farm.

text: The most suitable source of power for stationary equipment on the farm is
explanation: Electricity is the most suitable source of power for stationary farm equipment.

text: An important farm machine used for coupling many implements is
explanation: The tractor can be used for coupling a variety of farm implements for plowing, planting cultivating, fertilizing and harvesting crops.

text: Which of the following is the correct order for land preparation?
explanation: Land clearing↓Ploughing↓Harrowing↓Ridging

text: Which of the following surveying equipment is used for measuring angles during farm surveying?
explanation: Theodolite is a basic surveying instrument which is used to measure horizontal and vertical angles.

text: Which of the following farm practices is not mechanized?
explanation: Transplanting is not a mechanized farm practice, i.e it does not involve the use of machinery.

text: The main aim of mechanized agriculture is

options.C: having a large land area for cultivation

explanation: The major objective of mechanized agriculture is to have a large land area for cultivation.

text: The following are necessary operations in maize cultivation except?
explanation: Maize is cultivated by direct seeding, hence, nursery practice is not needed in maize cultivation.

text: Ginning is a method of processing
explanation: Ginning is the first mechanical process involved in processing cotton. Grinning is the process of removing seeds and debris from cotton thereby turning it into yam.

text: Ginger is propagated by
explanation: Ginger is propagated by portions of rhizomes known as seed rhizomes.

text: Which of the following is not correct about Stylosanthers gracilis?
explanation: Stylosanthes gracilis is not an animal legume.

text: Which of the following is not a problem of forest management?

options.A: absence of adequate information on the ecosystem
options.B: inadequate support from government for the development of forest resources
options.D: indiscriminate destruction of forest resources by bush fire

explanation: Planting varieties of timber does not include the problem of forest management.

text: The tree species commonly planted for pulp wood is
explanation: Gmelina is a tree species commonly planted for pulpwood.

text: Root-knot disease of tomato is caused by
explanation: Root knot disease of tomato is caused by nematodes.

text: Callosobruchus maculates is a common pest of
explanation: Callosobruchus macualatus is a species of beetles known commonly as the cowpea weevil or cowpea seed beetle.

text: Gummosis disease of citrus is caused by
explanation: Gummosis disease of citrus is caused by Phytophthora fungi.

text: Which of the weeds is dispersed by wind?
explanation: Tridax procumbeus is dispersed by wind.

text: The characteristic symptoms of mosaic disease of crops is usually observed on
explanation: The characteristic symptoms of mosaic disease are usually observed on leaves. The disease is characterized by leaves that are mottled with yellow, white and light or dark green spots and streaks (in other words, a mosaic of colors).

text: The correct sequence in the processes of crop improvement is
explanation: The correct sequence in the process of crop improvement is Introduction → selection → breeding.

text: A condition in which a gene does not manifest observable characteristics in the presence of its dominant allele is known as
explanation: This condition is known as Recessiveness.

text: If 100 pieces of pests is attacking an hectare of cocoa farm and 25% suddenly died while 40% of the remnant is sent for medical examination. What is the number of pest remaining?
explanation: 25% of 100 = 25 pests∴ Number of remnants = 100 - 25 = 75 pests40% of 75 = 30 pestsTotal pest remaining = 100 - (25 + 30) = 100 - 55 = 45 pests

text: If 200 layers will consume 25kg of feed per day. Calculate the amount of feed consumed by a layer per day.
Calculate the salvage value of a tractor with a depreciation value of ₦10,580.00 and initial cost of ₦50,000 after a year of use
explanation: Salvage value is the estimated book value of an asset after depreciation is calculated.Salvage value + Depreciation value = Cost priceSalvage value + 10,580 = 50,000∴ Salvage value = 50,000 - 10,580⇒ ₦39,420
